DOCNAME: CASE OF ULJAR AND OTHERS v. CROATIA
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicants are heirs of the late A.B. who died on DATE . The first and the second applicant are his children , and the third and the fourth applicants are his grandchildren ( children of his other daughter ) .

CARDINAL . In the context of inheritance proceedings following PERSON 's death , on DATE his former wife , PERSON , brought a civil action against the applicants in ORG ( PERSON ) . PERSON sought her share in co - ownership of a house on the account of certain investments she had made while living in common law marriage ( izvanbračna zajednica ) with the deceased .
CARDINAL . In the period between the entry into force of the LAW in respect of GPE and the rendering of the first - instance judgment , ORG held CARDINAL hearings .

CARDINAL . At the hearing held on CARDINAL DATE the applicants moved for evidence to be taken in order to prove that PERSON had not lived in a common law marriage with the plaintiff and that he had reconstructed his house independently with his own means . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the court heard CARDINAL and CARDINAL witnesses respectively .
CARDINAL . ORG then requested certain witnesses to be heard before other courts . In reply , it received TIME of the witness testimonies from ORG and ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants filed a counterclaim seeking a declaration that there had been no common law marriage between the plaintiff and the late A.B.
CARDINAL . The next hearing was held on DATE at which the court heard CARDINAL witnesses .

CARDINAL . At the next hearing held on DATE the court heard the second and the third applicant and adjourned the hearing for DATE , when the first applicant again sought for a number of witnesses to be heard .
CARDINAL . At the next hearings held on DATE and CARDINAL DATE the court heard yet more witnesses and on DATE it closed the main hearing .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court gave judgment dismissing both PERSON 's action and the applicants ' counterclaim . On appeal , on DATE ORG ( Županijski sud u ORG ) quashed the first - instance judgment and remitted the case finding that it was necessary to establish the plaintiff 's citizenship .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the first and the second applicant filed a constitutional complaint concerning the length of the proceedings . On DATE ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) declared their complaint inadmissible because ORG had in the meantime , on DATE , quashed the first - instance judgment and remitted the case .
CARDINAL . In the resumed proceedings , on DATE the President of ORG accepted the applicants ' request for withdrawal of the first - instance judge and assigned another judge to hear the case .
CARDINAL . The court held hearings on DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court adopted a decision declaring the plaintiff 's action inadmissible , because as a foreign national , she had not obtained the necessary permissions for acquisition of property in line with the domestic legislation . At the same time , ORG concluded that the applicants ' counterclaim had been withdrawn . PERSON appealed against that decision but on DATE ORG dismissed her appeal .
CARDINAL . The relevant part of section CARDINAL of LAW on LAW ( Ustavni zakon o PERSON , ORG no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , of CARDINAL DATE ; “ the LAW ” ) reads as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) The Constitutional Court shall examine a constitutional complaint whether or not all legal remedies have been exhausted if the court with jurisdiction fails to decide a claim concerning the applicant 's rights and obligations or a criminal charge against him or her within a reasonable time ...

( CARDINAL ) If a constitutional complaint ... under paragraph CARDINAL of this section is upheld , the Constitutional Court shall set a time - limit within which the court with jurisdiction must decide the case on the merits ...

( CARDINAL ) In a decision issued under paragraph CARDINAL of this section , the Constitutional Court shall assess appropriate compensation for the applicant for the violation of his or her constitutional rights ... The compensation shall be paid out of the ORG budget within DATE from the date a request for payment is lodged . ”
